intro: Cabomba warmingii, commonly known as the narrowleaf watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to parts of North America. It has slender, branching stems with small, opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often mistaken for those of other water plants. The plant produces tiny, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Cabomba warmingii is often found in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Its dense growth can provide habitat for aquatic organisms but may also become invasive in certain ecosystems.
